metadata.title: CVE-2023-3090 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - high
metadata.description:
A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the Linux Kernel ipvlan networkdriver can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Theout-of-bounds write is caused by missing skb->cb initialization in theipvlan network driver. The vulnerability is reachable if CONFIG_IPVLAN isenabled. We recommend upgrading past commit90cbed5247439a966b645b34eb0a2e037836ea8e.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3090` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
